recap_documents.description: MEMO ENDORSEMENT on re: [49 23-CV-10393-DEH]Letter filed by John Doe. ENDORSEMENT: The Court is in receipt of this letter, filed in Case No. 23-cv-10393 but apparently in reference to this case, No. 23-cv-10395. The Court construes this letter as requesting three forms of relief: discovery, preliminary relief, and sanctions. The requests for discovery and preliminary relief are DENIED as moot in light of the Court's dismissal of the Complaint (ECF No. 29). With respect to the request for sanctions, Defendant Columbia University is directed to respond in a letter, not to exceed five pages, no later than October 24, 2024. SO ORDERED. (Signed by Judge Dale E. Ho on 10/10/2024) (tg) (Entered: 10/10/2024)

caseName: Findability Sciences, Inc. v. Soft10, Inc.

recap_documents.description: Judge Denise J. Casper:  ORDER entered. MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The Court ALLOWS Findability Sciences' motion for summary judgment, D. 60, as to Counterclaim Counts II (promissory estoppel), VI (unjust enrichment), VIII (recission) and IX (conver sion) and DENIES the motion as to Counts I and II (declaratory judgment claims) and Counterclaim Counts I (breach of contract), III (violation of Mass. Gen. L. c. 93A), IV (misappropriation of trade secrets and intellectual property), V (breach of the covenant of good faith and fair dealing), VII (declaratory judgment counterclaim) and X (copyright infringement). (Hourihan, Lisa)
